articles.contents:
Jen Berg
          
          
          Teaching
          
          
          Scholarship

          Papers and Preprints
          Conferences and Travel
          Description for students
          
          
          ‚ò∞
          
          
      
        
          
            Jen Berg
          
          
            
              I am an Assistant Professor of Mathematics
              at Bucknell
              University.
              In 2016-19 I was an RTG Lovett Instructor at Rice
              University. I received my PhD in 2016 from the University
              of Texas at Austin and my B.S. in Mathematics from UIUC in
              2010. I grew up in Chicago, Illinois.
              My research interests lie at the intersection of number
              theory and geometry. Visit my scholarship page for
              more information about the flavor of questions I like to
              think about.
            
            
              I am an Assistant Professor of Mathematics

              University.

              My research interests lie at the intersection of number

              more information about the flavor of questions I like to
              think about.

articles.title: Teaching
articles.contents:
R Markdown
This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.
When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:


summary(cars)

     speed           dist       
 Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
 1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
 Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
 Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
 3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
 Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00  

Including Plots
You can also embed plots, for example:



Note that the echo = FALSE parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
